title._content: [Fanny A. Mulford house, Fulton Avenue, Hempstead, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [Fanny A. Mulford house, Fulton Avenue, Hempstead, New York. Arbor seat] [ca. 1916] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. Landscape: Ruth Bramley Dean, ca. 1915. Plan drawn by Ruth Bramley Dean, 4 West 40th Street, New York City. Today: Garden not extant. On slide (handwritten): "M" and "Mulford, Miss Fanny." Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 54. Subjects: Gardens--New York (State)--Hempstead--1910-1920. Arbors (Bowers)--New York (State)--Hempstead--1910-1920. Flowers--Hempstead--1910-1920. Format: Lantern slides--Hand-colored--1910-1920. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16260 Call Number: LC-J717-X100- 51
